page.title: 13LITTLE BLAKENHAM
page.content: Little Blakenham has no shops but has a small village hall,rectory church, farms,council houses,cottages and a housing estate. THE RECTORY The rectory is 500 years old.It is made of dutch and tudor architecture. It is supposed to be haunted by the ghost of Susan Mark.Her grave is in the graveyard.She died on 15 January 1847 age 74. ST MARYS CHURCH The church is made from flint and stones in early english decorated styles.The tower contains two bells.On the east wall of the chancel are several old paintings including a figure of St John the baptist.In the porch there is a stone with writing on it which says- This porch was restored in memory of William Arthur French who was rector from 1895 - 1934.
